name: Legendary Broadway Performances Quiz | Humanities | 10 Questions

questions.text: This actor turned in an incredible performance as Willy Loman in Arthur Miller's "Death of A Salesman".
questions.explanation:
Lee J. Cobb

	Willy Loman is one of the legendary characters in Broadway drama; "Salesman" is often considered to be Miller's masterpiece. Long before Dustin Hoffman did the role on Broadway, Cobb had turned in a highly-acclaimed performance in the role.

questions.text: This actor continued his starring role in the movie in Hart and Kaufman's Broadway hit, "The Man Who Came to Dinner".
questions.explanation:
Monty Woolley.

	Barrymore was considered for the role in the movie. It's hard to believe that anyone could have done a better job than Woolley. Durante appeared in the movie.

questions.text: Shirley Booth was a huge success on Broadway (and in the subsequent movie) in this play by William Inge.
options: Dark at the Top of the Stairs
questions.explanation:
Come Back, Little Sheba.

	Before she starred in the tv series "Hazel", Booth turned in a critically well-received performance in this tale by the haunted, tragic Inge.

questions.text: This actor starred as "Big Daddy" in the Tennessee Williams play (and subsequent movie) "Cat On A Hot Tin Roof".
questions.explanation:
Burl Ives.

	Ives was never better. (Brynner's claim to Broadway fame is, of course, in the musical "The King and I".)

questions.text: The renowned Paul Robeson gave a powerful starring performance in this Eugene O'Neill play.
questions.explanation:
The Emperor Jones.

	This is generally considered to be one of Robeson's best roles - and one of O'Neill's best works.

questions.text: This actor provided a superb performance as Abe Lincoln in the play (and movie) by Robert E. Sherwood, "Abe Lincoln in Illinois".
questions.explanation:
Raymond Massey.

	Massey was brilliant in the movie version. (It's ironic that America's greatest president was played by a Canadian.)

questions.text: Marlon Brando electrified audiences on Broadway (and in the movie) with his performance as Stanley in this Tennessee Williams play.
questions.explanation:
Streetcar Named Desire.

	Brando played Stanley Kowalski, shrieking out his "hey, Stella" to audiences night after night.

questions.text: Jose Ferrer won acclaim for his performance in this classic play.
options: Six Characters in Search of an Author
questions.explanation:
Cyrano de Bergerac.

	Ferrer won great reviews for his performance in the title role of Edmond Rostand's work.

questions.text: Richard Burton, John Gielgud and Ralph Richardson are some of the fine actors who have starred in this masterpiece by Shakespeare.
questions.explanation:
Hamlet.

	Others who have played the role (in one medium or another) include Laurence Olivier, Kenneth Branagh and Mel Gibson.

questions.text: "Our American Cousin" is famous not for its literary merit, but for its performance during the assassination of Abe Lincoln. Who starred in the play that night?
questions.explanation:
Laura Keene.

	Famed actress Laura Keene had the misfortune of being on stage when Lincoln was shot. Jenny Lind was an entertainer of approximately the same time period. Asia Booth was the sister of the assassin. Elizabeth Poe was the actress mother of Edgar Allan Poe. Harry Hawk was the male lead in the play.)
